snippet: Amaury and Amed Villa were accused of stealing $80 million worth of drugs at a warehouse in Connecticut in 2010, which the authorities said was the largest larceny of its kind in United States history.
abstract: Brothers Amaury and Amed Villa are accused of stealing $80 million worth of drugs from an Eli Lilly warehouse in Enfield, Connecticut in 2010 in what is being called the largest theft of prescription drugs in United States history. Photo (M)

byline.original: By PETER APPLEBOME and KRISTIN HUSSEY

lead_paragraph: The largest theft of prescription drugs in United States history, as described by the authorities, was intricately orchestrated and meticulously executed. There were several round-trip flights between New York and Miami. There were leased tractor-trailers and upscale rental cars. The tools used to drill a hole in a roof and disable part of a security system came from a Home Depot in Flushing, Queens.

headline.main: 2 Brothers Accused in Huge Theft of Prescription Drugs
